cont.entity_a: Performs well with unbelievable battery life.
cont.entity_b: Performance is fantastic, compatible with Mac.

cont.entity_a: Duracell Ultra batteries last almost a year.
cont.entity_b: Rechargeable batteries last around 3 months. Battery life is long with NiMH rechargeables.

cont.entity_a: Works well on any surface and is comfortable to hold. Comfortable and easy to use. Design is comfortable for both left and right-hand use.
cont.entity_b: Comfortable with lots of options, including media controls. Symmetrical design is comfortable.

cont.entity_a: Connects instantly without needing software installation.

USB.comm: USB receiver is large and has a limited range.

cont.entity_a: The USB adapter stores in the mouse to prevent loss.
cont.entity_b: USB receiver is long, occupying one USB port.

cont.entity_a: Reasonable price at $19.99 with no tax or shipping.
Not too heavy, providing a balanced feel.
Range from the signal box is limited, less than 6 feet. USB receiver is large and has a limited range.
cont.entity_b: Old style with limited range but portable. Looks cool with good range.

cont.entity_a: Design is comfortable for both left and right-hand use. Large mouse size may not be suitable for small hands.
cont.entity_b: Symmetrical design is comfortable. Not suitable for left-handed users.

cont.entity_a: Large mouse size may not be suitable for small hands. Mouse is too big for small hands, causing discomfort.
Signal strength issues and sensor jumpiness. Signal strength is routinely low.
Not responsive and requires a mouse pad for accurate use. Sensitive mouse with pointer needing adjustment.
cont.entity_b: Cursor jumps and stops moving on axis.

cont.entity_a: Ergonomic issues with button placement and size.

cont.entity_b: Volume and media control buttons are convenient. Media controls are useful.
Buttons are not programmable. Erratic behavior and spontaneous volume increase.
